item.title: Laura add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "Write what should not be forgotten." -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Laura add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "The library is inhabited by spirits that come out of the pages at night." -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Laura add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "Accept the children the way we accept trees—with gratitude, because they are a blessing—but do not have expectations or desires. You don’t expect trees to change, you love them as they are." -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Laura add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "We only have what we give." -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Laura add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "Words are not that important when you recognize intentions." -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Laura add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "Fear is inevitable, I have to accept that, but I cannot allow it to paralyze me." -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Laura add a quote by Karl Lagerfeld
item.description: "We live in a dark and romantic and quite tragic world." -- Karl Lagerfeld

item.title: Laura add a quote by Karl Lagerfeld
item.description: "People who do a job that claims to be creative have to be alone to recharge their batteries. You can’t live 24 hours a day in the spotlight and remain creative. For people like me, solitude is a victory." -- Karl Lagerfeld

item.title: Laura add a quote by Karl Lagerfeld
item.description: "Don't look to the approval of others for your mental stability" -- Karl Lagerfeld

item.title: Laura add a quote by Karl Lagerfeld
item.description: "Books are a hard-bound drug with no danger of an overdose. I am the happy victim of books." -- Karl Lagerfeld

item.title: Laura add a quote by Karl Lagerfeld
item.description: "People who say that yesterday was better than today are ultimately devaluing their own existence." -- Karl Lagerfeld

item.title: Laura add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "So, please, oh please, we beg, we pray, go throw your TV set away, and in its place you can install, a lovely bookcase on the wall." -- Roald Dahl
